descr.p: The Pipes unit implements streams that are wrappers around the OS's pipe functionality. It creates a pair of streams, and what is written to one stream can be read from another.

element.name: sysutils
element.short: uses for exception support.

element.name: Classes
element.short: Used for the TSTream class definition.

element.name: EPipeError
element.short: Exception raised when an invalid operation is performed on a pipe stream.

element.name: EPipeSeek
element.short: Exception raised when an invalid seek operation is attempted on a pipe.

element.name: EPipeCreation
element.short: Exception raised when an error occurred during the creation of a pipe pair.

element.name: TInputPipeStream
element.short: TStream descendent which wraps the read end of a pipe.
element.descr: TInputPipeStream is created by the call to represent the reading end of a pipe. It is a TStream descendent which does not allow writing, and which mimics the seek operation.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Write
element.short: Write data to the stream.
element.descr: Write overrides the parent implementation of Write. On a TInputPipeStream will always raise an exception, as the pipe is read-only.
element.errors: An EStreamError exception is raised when this function is called.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Write.Result
element.short: Number of bytes actually written.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Write.Buffer
element.short: Memory buffer containing the data to be written.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Write.Count
element.short: Number of bytes that must be written.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Seek
element.short: Set the current position of the stream

descr.p: Seek overrides the standard Seek implementation. Normally, pipe streams stderr are not seekable. The TInputPipeStream stream tries to provide seek capabilities for the following limited number of cases:

dl.dd: If Offset is larger than the current position, then the remaining bytes are skipped by reading them from the stream and discarding them.
If Offset is zero, the current position is returned. If it is positive, then Offset bytes are skipped by reading them from the stream and discarding them, if the stream is of type iosInput.

descr.p: All other cases will result in a EPipeSeek exception.

element.errors: An exception is raised if the stream does not allow the requested seek operation.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Seek.Result
element.short: New position of the stream.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Seek.Offset
element.short: Offset, in bytes, starting at Origin

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Seek.Origin
element.short: Where to start counting Offset bytes.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Read
element.short: Read data from the stream to a buffer.
element.descr: Read calls the inherited read and adjusts the internal position pointer of the stream.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Read.Result
element.short: Number of bytes actually read from the stream.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Read.Buffer
element.short: Memory buffer where to write the data read from the stream.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Read.Count
element.short: Number of bytes to read from the stream.

element.name: TInputPipeStream.NumBytesAvailable
element.short: Number of bytes available for reading.

descr.p: NumBytesAvailable is the number of bytes available for reading. This is the number of bytes in the OS buffer for the pipe. It is not a number of bytes in an internal buffer.

If this number is nonzero, then reading NumBytesAvailable bytes from the stream will not block the process. Reading more than NumBytesAvailable bytes will block the process, while it waits for the requested number of bytes to become available.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream
element.short: TStream descendent which wraps the write end of a pipe.
element.descr: TOutputPipeStream is created by the call to represent the writing end of a pipe. It is a TStream descendent which does not allow reading.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Seek
element.short: Sets the position in the stream
element.descr: Seek is overridden in TOutputPipeStream. Calling this method will always raise an exception: an output pipe is not seekable.
element.errors: An exception is raised if this method is called.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Seek.Result
element.short: New position of the stream.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Seek.Offset
element.short: Offset, in bytes, starting at Origin

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Seek.Origin
element.short: Where to start counting Offset bytes.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Read
element.short: Read data from the stream.
element.descr: Read overrides the parent Read implementation. It always raises an exception, because a output pipe is write-only.
element.errors: An EStreamError exception is raised when this function is called.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Read.Result
element.short: Number of bytes actually read from the stream.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Read.Buffer
element.short: Memory buffer where to write the data read from the stream.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Read.Count
element.short: Number of bytes to read from the stream.

element.name: CreatePipeHandles
element.short: Function to create a set of pipe handles
element.descr: CreatePipeHandles provides an OS-independent way to create a set of pipe filehandles. These handles are inheritable to child processes. The reading end of the pipe is returned in InHandle, the writing end in OutHandle.

element.name: CreatePipeHandles.Result
element.short: True if the call was successful, False if not.

element.name: CreatePipeHandles.Inhandle
element.short: File handle for reading end of the pipe

element.name: CreatePipeHandles.OutHandle
element.short: File handle for writing end of the pipe

element.name: CreatePipeStreams
element.short: Create a pair of pipe stream.

descr.p: CreatePipeStreams creates a set of pipe file descriptors with , and if that call is successful, a pair of streams is created: InPipe and OutPipe.

On some systems (notably: windows) the size of the buffer to be used for communication between 2 ends of the buffer can be specified in the parameter. This parameter is ignored on systems that do not support setting the buffer size.

element.errors: If no pipe handles could be created, an exception is raised.

element.name: CreatePipeStreams.InPipe
element.short: Contains the read end of the pipe on return

element.name: CreatePipeStreams.OutPipe
element.short: Contains the write end of the pipe on return.

element.name: EPipeMsg
element.short: Constant used in EPipeCreation exception.

element.name: ENoSeekMsg
element.short: Constant used in EPipeSeek exception.

element.name: sysutils
element.short: Exception support

element.name: Classes
element.short: Stream definitions

element.name: TInputPipeStream.Destroy
element.short: Destroy this instance of the input pipe stream
element.descr: Destroy overrides the destructor to close the pipe handle, prior to calling the inherited destructor.

element.name: TOutputPipeStream.Destroy
element.short: Destroy this instance of the output pipe stream
element.descr: Destroy overrides the destructor to close the pipe handle, prior to calling the inherited destructor.

element.name: CreatePipeHandles.APipeBufferSize
element.short: Buffer size to be used for the pipe
